column2: Whole grain bread, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
column6: 4. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Chia seeds, Coconut milk (lactose-free), Maple syrup (or other sweetener), Vanilla extract, Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
column3: 1. In a bowl mix chia seeds coconut milk maple syrup and vanilla extract.
column4: 2. Stir well and let it sit in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight until thickened.

column2: Oats, Almond milk (lactose-free), Berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Chia seeds, Maple syrup
column3: 1. Cook oats according to package instructions using almond milk.
column4: 2. Once cooked top with mixed berries and chia seeds.
column5: 3. Drizzle with maple syrup if desired.

column2: Frozen mixed berries, Banana, Spinach, Almond milk (lactose-free), Chia seeds, Maple syrup (optional)
column3: 1. In a blender combine frozen mixed berries banana spinach almond milk and chia seeds.
column5: 3. Pour into a bowl and top with a drizzle of maple syrup if desired.

column2: Whole wheat flour, Baking powder, Almond milk (lactose-free), Apple cider vinegar, Maple syrup, Vanilla extract, Fresh fruit (such as berries, banana slices)
column3: 1. In a mixing bowl whisk together whole wheat flour and baking powder.
column4: 2. In a separate bowl mix almond milk and apple cider vinegar and let it sit for a few minutes to curdle.
column5: 3. Add maple syrup and vanilla extract to the almond milk mixture.
column6: 4. Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed.
column7: 5. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and pour batter to form pancakes.
column8: 6. Cook until bubbles form on the surface then flip and cook until golden brown.
column9: 7. Serve topped with fresh fruit and additional maple syrup if desired.

column2: Quinoa, Mixed vegetables (such as cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, red onion), Chickpeas, Lemon juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as parsley, cilantro)
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. In a large bowl combine cooked quinoa mixed vegetables and chickpeas.
column5: 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil and season with salt pepper and fresh herbs.
column6: 4. Toss to combine and serve chilled.

column2: Quinoa, Mixed greens (such as lettuce, spinach, kale), Roasted vegetables (such as sweet potatoes, Brussels sprouts, carrots), Avocado, Hummus, Lemon tahini dressing
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. Assemble bowls with cooked quinoa mixed greens roasted vegetables sliced avocado and dollops of hummus.
column5: 3. Drizzle with lemon tahini dressing before serving.

column2: Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas), Tofu, Soy sauce (check for gluten-free), Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Sesame seeds, Green onions
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column4: 2. Add minced garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant.
column5: 3. Add sliced tofu and cook until lightly browned.
column6: 4. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column7: 5. Stir in soy sauce and cook for another minute.
column8: 6. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.

column2: Lentils, Mixed vegetables (such as carrots, celery, onion, bell peppers), Vegetable broth, Crushed tomatoes, Garlic, Bay leaves, Thyme, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion carrots celery and bell peppers to the pot and cook until softened.
column5: 3. Stir in minced garlic and cook for another minute.
column6: 4. Add lentils vegetable broth crushed tomatoes bay leaves thyme salt and pepper to the pot.
column7: 5. Bring the soup to a boil then reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until lentils are tender.

column2: Whole grain wraps (check for gluten-free), Hummus, Mixed greens, Sliced vegetables (such as bell peppers, cucumber, carrots), Avocado, Sunflower seeds
column3: 1. Spread a generous amount of hummus on a whole grain wrap.
column4: 2. Layer with mixed greens sliced vegetables sliced avocado and sunflower seeds.
column5: 3. Roll up tightly and slice in half before serving.

column2: Whole grain pasta (check for gluten-free), Olive oil, Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, cherry tomatoes), Garlic, Lemon juice, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as basil, parsley)
column3: 1. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
column5: 3. Add minced garlic and mixed vegetables to the skillet and sauté until tender.
column6: 4. Toss cooked pasta with the vegetable mixture.
column7: 5. Season with lemon juice salt pepper and fresh herbs.

column2: Extra-firm tofu, Coconut milk, Curry paste, Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, snap peas), Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Rice
column3: 1. Press tofu to remove excess moisture then cut into cubes.
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
column5: 3. Add minced garlic and ginger to the skillet and cook until fragrant.
column6: 4. Add tofu cubes and cook until lightly browned on all sides.
column7: 5. Stir in curry paste and coconut milk then add mixed vegetables.
column8: 6. Simmer until vegetables are tender and tofu is heated through.
column9: 7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Lentils, Mixed vegetables (such as carrots, peas, corn), Onion, Garlic, Vegetable broth, Tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce (make sure it's vegan), Mashed potatoes, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
column5: 3. Add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until softened.
column6: 4. Stir in lentils mixed vegetables vegetable broth tomato paste and Worcestershire sauce.
column7: 5. Simmer until lentils are cooked and mixture thickens.
column8: 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
column9: 7. Transfer the lentil mixture to a baking dish and spread mashed potatoes over the top.
column10: 8. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until heated through and the top is golden brown.

column2: Chickpeas, Coconut milk, Curry powder, Tomato sauce, Mixed vegetables (such as cauliflower, carrots, peas), Onion, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Rice
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion minced garlic and grated ginger to the pot and cook until softened.
column5: 3. Stir in curry powder and cook for another minute.
column6: 4. Add chickpeas mixed vegetables coconut milk and tomato sauce to the pot.
column7: 5. Simmer until vegetables are tender and curry thickens.
column8: 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Bell peppers, Quinoa, Black beans, Corn, Onion, Garlic, Tomato sauce, Chili powder, Cumin, Paprika, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
column5: 3. In a skillet sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
column6: 4. Add cooked quinoa black beans corn tomato sauce chili powder cumin paprika salt and pepper to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until heated through.
column7: 5. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds.
column8: 6. Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture.
column9: 7. Place stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes.
column10: 8. Optionally top with vegan cheese during the last 5 minutes of baking.
